= Conky =

To create a Conky configuration file displaying a cheat sheet with two rows, where the first row contains keybindings aligned left and the second row contains commands aligned right, you can follow these steps:

Install Conky: If you haven't already installed Conky, you can do so using your package manager. For example, on Ubuntu or Debian-based systems, you can install it with:

sudo apt-get install conky-all

Create a Conky configuration file: Create a new file with a .conkyrc extension in your home directory or in ~/.config/conky/.


.conkyrc
========
Edit the configuration file: Open the .conkyrc file in a text editor and add the following configuration:

alignment = 'top_left'
background = false
border_width = 1
cpu_avg_samples = 2
default_color = 'white'
default_outline_color = 'white'
default_shade_color = 'white'
draw_borders = false
draw_graph_borders = true
draw_outline = false
draw_shades = false
use_xft = true
font = 'DejaVu Sans Mono:size=10'
gap_x = 10
gap_y = 10
minimum_height = 400
minimum_width = 600
net_avg_samples = 2
no_buffers = true
out_to_console = false
out_to_stderr = false
extra_newline = false
own_window = true
own_window_type = 'normal'
own_window_transparent = false
own_window_hints = 'undecorated,sticky,skip_taskbar,skip_pager'
stippled_borders = 0
update_interval = 2.0
uppercase = false
use_spacer = 'none'

TEXT
=====
${color white}${alignc}Keybindings${color}${alignr}Commands
${color white}${alignc}-------------------------${color}${alignr}----------------------
${color white}${alignc}Ctrl + a${color}${alignr}Select all
${color white}${alignc}Ctrl + c${color}${alignr}Copy
${color white}${alignc}Ctrl + d${color}${alignr}Mark for deletion
${color white}${alignc}Ctrl + e${color}${alignr}Edit
${color white}${alignc}Ctrl + f${color}${alignr}Find/search
${color white}${alignc}Ctrl + n${color}${alignr}Create new directory
${color white}${alignc}Ctrl + s${color}${alignr}Toggle selection
${color white}${alignc}Ctrl + v${color}${alignr}Paste
${color white}${alignc}Ctrl + w${color}${alignr}Close current tab or pane
${color white}${alignc}Ctrl + x${color}${alignr}Cut



Run Conky:
==========
conky -d -c ~/.conkyrc
